objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the primary author and publisher of this report, responsible for the analysis and dissemination of the findings about UMBRELLA STAND malware.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND Hardcoded C2 IP
objects.description: C2 infrastructure: Hardcoded default C2 IP in the UMBRELLA STAND malware sample, used for remote command and control.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND Hidden Directory
objects.description: Hidden directory used by UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling to store and hide malicious binaries on Fortinet devices.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND Result File
objects.description: Malicious result file created during remote shell command execution. Used for exfiltration of command output before deletion.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND Chunk Collection Info File
objects.description: INI file used for tracking collected/output chunks from executed commands in the second shell implementation of UMBRELLA STAND.

objects.name: BusyBox Binary (renamed)
objects.description: Renamed BusyBox binary ('lidwok') deployed by actors in the hidden directory for use as a backdoor shell environment.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND Shared Object
objects.description: Shared object loaded via ldpreload for persistence and process hooking, associated with UMBRELLA STAND operations.

objects.name: ldpreload Configuration File
objects.description: System file modified by UMBRELLA STAND to achieve persistence through loading malicious shared objects at process start.

objects.name: Process Listing Path (Spoofing)
objects.description: Used by UMBRELLA STAND for process name spoofing and to locate/modify process argument listings on infected systems.

objects.name: Spoofed Process Name
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND overwrites the process name on infected devices to '/bin/httpsd' for defense evasion and blending in.

objects.name: Actor Log File
objects.description: Log file referenced in injected tooling, indicative of UMBRELLA STAND malware presence and execution activity.

objects.name: Injected Library File
objects.description: File injected into PID 1 by dskz for process injection, possibly related to reboot hooking. Indicator of malicious modification.

objects.name: FortiOS Trusted Directory (Targeted for Hiding)
objects.description: Legitimate Fortinet directory targeted by cisz for string replacement to hide actor's directory '/data2/.ztls/' from admin.

objects.name: Modified System Binary
objects.description: System binary modified by UMBRELLA STAND for string replacement and hiding malicious activities on the device.

objects.name: Indicator for blghtd (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND networking binary 'blghtd', deployed as part of the malware.

objects.name: Indicator for blghtd (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND networking binary 'blghtd', deployed as part of the malware.

objects.name: Indicator for blghtd (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND networking binary 'blghtd', deployed as part of the malware.

objects.name: Indicator for jvnlpe (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash for UMBRELLA STAND binary 'jvnlpe', which is used to monitor and restart 'blghtd'.

objects.name: Indicator for jvnlpe (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash for UMBRELLA STAND binary 'jvnlpe', which is used to monitor and restart 'blghtd'.

objects.name: Indicator for jvnlpe (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash for UMBRELLA STAND binary 'jvnlpe', which is used to monitor and restart 'blghtd'.

objects.name: Indicator for cisz (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of UMBRELLA STAND binary 'cisz', responsible for initialization and launching other components.

objects.name: Indicator for cisz (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of UMBRELLA STAND binary 'cisz', responsible for initialization and launching other components.

objects.name: Indicator for cisz (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of UMBRELLA STAND binary 'cisz', responsible for initialization and launching other components.

objects.name: Indicator for libguic.so2 (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of UMBRELLA STAND shared object 'libguic.so2', loaded using ldpreload for malicious process injection.

objects.name: Indicator for libguic.so2 (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of UMBRELLA STAND shared object 'libguic.so2', loaded using ldpreload for malicious process injection.

objects.name: Indicator for libguic.so2 (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of UMBRELLA STAND shared object 'libguic.so2', loaded using ldpreload for malicious process injection.

objects.name: Indicator for reboot_hooker (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of reboot hooking binary (unknown filename), used by UMBRELLA STAND to hook device reboots.

objects.name: Indicator for reboot_hooker (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of reboot hooking binary (unknown filename), used by UMBRELLA STAND to hook device reboots.

objects.name: Indicator for reboot_hooker (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of reboot hooking binary (unknown filename), used by UMBRELLA STAND to hook device reboots.

objects.name: Indicator for a (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of UMBRELLA STAND file encryptor binary 'a', used for AES encryption/decryption of files during malware deployment.

objects.name: Indicator for a (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of UMBRELLA STAND file encryptor binary 'a', used for AES encryption/decryption of files during malware deployment.

objects.name: Indicator for a (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of UMBRELLA STAND file encryptor binary 'a', used for AES encryption/decryption of files during malware deployment.

objects.name: Indicator for lidwok (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of BusyBox binary ('lidwok'), tool deployed by actors for shell environment and command execution.

objects.name: Indicator for lidwok (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of BusyBox binary ('lidwok'), tool deployed by actors for shell environment and command execution.

objects.name: Indicator for lidwok (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of BusyBox binary ('lidwok'), tool deployed by actors for shell environment and command execution.

objects.name: Indicator for dskz (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of UMBRELLA STAND actor tool 'dskz', used to inject libraries into processes for process injection.

objects.name: Indicator for dskz (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of UMBRELLA STAND actor tool 'dskz', used to inject libraries into processes for process injection.

objects.name: Indicator for dskz (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of UMBRELLA STAND actor tool 'dskz', used to inject libraries into processes for process injection.

objects.name: Indicator for tdp (tcpdump v4.99.1) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of tcpdump v4.99.1 binary ('tdp'), used by UMBRELLA STAND actors for network traffic capture on compromised devices.

objects.name: Indicator for tdp (tcpdump v4.99.1) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of tcpdump v4.99.1 binary ('tdp'), used by UMBRELLA STAND actors for network traffic capture on compromised devices.

objects.name: Indicator for tdp (tcpdump v4.99.1) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of tcpdump v4.99.1 binary ('tdp'), used by UMBRELLA STAND actors for network traffic capture on compromised devices.

objects.name: Indicator for nbso (nbtscan v1.0.35) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of nbtscan v1.0.35 binary ('nbso'), used by UMBRELLA STAND actors for network/discovery activity.

objects.name: Indicator for nbso (nbtscan v1.0.35) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of nbtscan v1.0.35 binary ('nbso'), used by UMBRELLA STAND actors for network/discovery activity.

objects.name: Indicator for nbso (nbtscan v1.0.35) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of nbtscan v1.0.35 binary ('nbso'), used by UMBRELLA STAND actors for network/discovery activity.

objects.name: umbrella stand
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND is a medium sophistication malware designed to target Fortinet devices, specifically FortiGate 100D series firewalls. It is a collection of interconnected actor binaries likely deployed by exploiting vulnerabilities in the target device. The malware enables remote shell execution, AES-encrypted communications with its C2 server over fake TLS, and various persistence, defence evasion, and process injection techniques. UMBRELLA STAND facilitates long-term access to the compromised device, uses publicly available tools, hooks the device reboot process, and is composed of multiple components including blghtd, jvnlpe, cisz, libguic.so2, and a file encryptor 'a'. It has the ability to hide using hidden directories and generic filenames, uses AES encrypted stack strings to hinder analysis, and can be controlled through complex command and control message structures.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: Fortinet is the manufacturer of the FortiGate 100D series firewalls targeted by the UMBRELLA STAND malware.

objects.name: coathanger
objects.description: COATHANGER is referenced as related malware with several tooling similarities to UMBRELLA STAND. Some tools described in COATHANGER reporting were also found deployed on Fortinet devices victimized by UMBRELLA STAND.

objects.name: shoe rack
objects.description: SHOE RACK is briefly referenced as a previously unknown piece of malware identified on the device alongside UMBRELLA STAND. Further details are outside the scope of this report.

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
encrypted stack strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {C6 45 D0 92 C6 45 D1 48 C6 45 D2 D6 C6 45 D3 E3 C6 45
D4 39 C6 45 D5 EE C6 45 D6 CE C6 45 D7 E4 C6 45 D8 59 C6 45 D9 58
C6 45 DA 97 C6 45 DB E5 C6 45 DC 2E C6 45 DD 27 C6 45 DE 98 C6 45
DF DE C6 45 E0 93 C6 45 E1 A8 C6 45 E2 77 C6 45 E3 9B C6 45 E4 4A
C6 45 E5 F0 C6 45 E6 EF C6 45 E7 74 C6 45 E8 80 C6 45 E9 2D C6 45
EA EB C6 45 EB 30 C6 45 EC 1F C6 45 ED B5 C6 45 EE D9 C6 45 EF C7}// Key
        $ = {C6 45 C0 77 C6 45 C1 90 C6 45 C2 3D C6 45 C3 35 C6 45
C4 A4 C6 45 C5 9F C6 45 C6 0F C6 45 C7 5E C6 45 C8 F5 C6 45 C9 52
C6 45 CA 44 C6 45 CB 69 C6 45 CC B9 C6 45 CD C0 C6 45 CE BA C6 45
CF DC} // IV
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings, if string obfuscation is not present."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {ED B8 83 20}
        $ = "%s/%d.sv"
        $ = "%s/%s.ini"
        $ = "%s>%s 2>&1"
        $ = "%[^=]=%[^=]"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/"
        $ = "/proc/%s/status"
        $ = "%*s %s"
        $ = "./lidwok killall blghtd"
        $ = "89.44.194.32"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/lidwok"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        5 of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings present in tooling."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "LoadMsg"
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "error"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
custom base64 alphabet and encryption key reference."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = ",((@=+utivp45ztvo6&RFvt&*^tp&!q;"
        $ =
"ef345FGHIJKLMNOPWghijklmnoXYd67TUVABC89+/pqrstQRSDEZabcuvwxyz012"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "dxumbsu"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "loadMsg"
        $ ="/SYSV64564856"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings used to configure injection."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/SYSV64564856"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "version 2"
        $ = "init_drivercheck"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains functionality to receive and run Shell commands.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains AES-encrypted strings.

objects.name: Process Injection
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses tooling to perform process injection.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND binaries had been deleted from the device.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Process Argument Spoofing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND modifies it’s process name.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Hidden Files and Directories
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling use hidden directories.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Kernel Modules and Extensions
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to modify reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to load via ldpreload.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND performs process discovery to check that its main process is still executing.

objects.name: Network Service Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with nbtscan which can list NetBIOS computer names.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with tcpdump which can be, and was, used to perform packet captures.

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol or Service Impersonation
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses fake TLS for communications with the C2 server.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Umbrella Stand
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. umbrella stand.
